text:
“They're really enjoying it! Yes, they're having a great time! They've cried about it and gotten used to it. People can get used to anything, the bad ones!”

He fell silent, thinking.

“What if I'm wrong?” he suddenly shouted after thinking for a moment. “What if people aren’t really bad? I mean, all of humanity—then everything else is just a belief, fake fears, and there are no limits, and everything is as it should be.”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** The narrator reflects on the nature of humanity, questioning whether the perception of man as a scoundrel is merely a prejudice.
